alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 12:25PM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow tonight and Tuesday. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, except 10 to 20 inches above pass level. Winds gusting 40 to 50 mph at times, including localized whiteout conditions. * WHERE...Malad Summit, Malad, Preston, Thatcher, St Charles, Montpelier, Georgetown Summit, and Georgetown. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially tonight and Tuesday. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region
